alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lonoke and southeastern Pulaski Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wrightsville, or 8 miles southeast of Downtown Little Rock, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... Lonoke... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Keo... McCreanor... Sweet Home... Sisemore... Estes... Toltec Mounds State Park... Scott... Baucum... Bevis Corner... Higgins... Willow Beach... Toltec... Culler... College Station... Pettus... Seaton... This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 177 and 182. Interstate 440 between mile markers 5 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Arkansas.
